summary: Completed comprehensive testing of DLLC HR & Payroll application. Backend: 26/26 tests passed. Frontend: All major features working. Fixed 1 bug in payslip modal (JSON parse error).
critical_code_review_comments: Salary.js had JSON.parse issue when allowances/deductions were already objects - FIXED
AWS S3 is not configured - documents use local storage fallback (base64 in DB) which is fine for MVP
seed_data_creation: Demo users already loaded via /api/demo/load-users endpoint
context_for_next_testing_agent: All features tested and working: Login (no duplicate text), Dashboard with charts, Employee Management with search/filter/pagination, Attendance with check-in/check-out, Documents with upload/categories, Salary with payslip PDF generation. Fixed JSON parse bug in Salary.js for payslip modal.

login_page.notes: DLLC logo displayed, no duplicate 'DL Law Corporation' text, HR Management Portal subtitle visible

dashboard.notes: Analytics dashboard with KPI metrics (Total Employees, Pending Leaves, Departments, Payroll Pending, Announcements), Department Distribution pie chart, Employee Status bar chart, Role Distribution pie chart, Growth Trend area chart

employee_management.notes: Search by name/email/ID works, Status/Department/Role filters work, Create Employee modal opens and closes, Pagination works, Status change dropdown available

attendance.notes: Check-in/Check-out functionality works, Date and Employee filters available, Attendance history table displays correctly

documents.notes: Upload button present, Category filter available, Document guidelines displayed. Note: Using local storage fallback (S3 not configured)

salary_payroll.notes: Create Salary Entry modal works, Payslip modal displays correctly with company letterhead, Download PDF button available

employee_dashboard.notes: Employee-specific dashboard with attendance card, Quick Actions (Apply Leave, View Payslips, Get ID Card), Announcements section

bugs_fixed.issue: JSON.parse error when viewing payslip - allowances/deductions were already objects not strings
bugs_fixed.fix: Added type check before JSON.parse: typeof data === 'string' ? JSON.parse(data) : data
